repo.description: Nvim Node.js client and plugin host
repo.name: node-client

body:
Closes #314.

## Problem:
This test may time out, because the `proc.on('close')` event is never triggered.

    FAIL src/attach/attach.test.ts (5.62 s)
      ● Nvim API › emits "disconnect" after quit
        thrown: "Exceeded timeout of 5000 ms for a test while waiting for `done()` to be called.

          |   });
          |
        > |   it('emits "disconnect" after quit', done => {
          |   ^
          |     const disconnectMock = jest.fn();
          |     nvim.on('disconnect', disconnectMock);
          |     nvim.quit();

          at it (src/attach/attach.test.ts:138:3)
          at Object.describe (src/attach/attach.test.ts:6:1)

## Solution:
Listen for 'exit' instead of 'close'. This may indicate that Nvim or node-client
is not properly closing all of its streams, but that is unrelated to this
particular test.

comment_data.body: Should I increase timeout of this test, like 10s ?

No, most likely either the test harness (jest) is interfering with something (jest is known to proxy the `process` but idk if that affects `proc.on` here), or there's a race (bug) in our EventEmitter implementation, or we need to rethink the approach of this test.

Thanks for looking at this. I think the `done` mechanism works, the problem is either in our test logic or there's a race during "teardown" so e.g. the EventEmitter event is not getting triggered.

Or maybe it's related to jest's "mocking" implementation, so removing the use of `jest.fn` could help (for most of our tests we have no reason to use it, especially this one).
If we remove the mock function, how do we make sure `disconnect` is indeed emitted?

since the test is timing out, that means this `done` is not called, which means the 'close' event isn't emitted (or stuff is getting disposed before handling the emitted 'close' event).

This proc.on was added in https://github.com/neovim/node-client/commit/c9a3dd009e08d5a4984e6da2a0e9a1e7bb2dca9c for some reason. But later the `proc.kill` call was removed, so whatever reason that `proc.on` was added no longer exists. 

~~we should just restore the old logic, which simply did `nvim.on('disconnect', done);`~~
Could we rerun ci couple more times to see the job failed again or not ?
Yeah, I understand that, but how race could happen to cause this problem?
Do we still need the disconnect call on proc ?
oh, that causes the test harness (jest) to kill Nvim too early, which then raises EPIPE because Nvim still has messages to process.

Based on local runs, changing this to 'exit' seems more reliable. It's strange that 'close' is sometimes not emitted, but that was never the purpose of this test...
```suggestion
    proc.on('exit', () => {
```
Make sense, we only want make sure disconnect is called.
Yeah, we can fix the root cause later and merge this as a temp fix ?

comment_regular_data.body: Oops, failed again, so the mock function indeed not the issue here.
We can run CI a few more times to see if it's working.
Looks like it happens on windows. see https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/4500

CI has been green 10+ times 🎉 

> Looks like it happens on windows. see [nodejs/node#4500](https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/4500)

https://github.com/neovim/node-client/issues/314 happens on all platforms. Based on some local testing, it looks like `stderr` is not closed, and that would be why 'close' event does not emit. This may indicate a bug in node-client or Nvim.

title: test(attach): improve disconnect test
